abstracts.cdata!:
Overall. project outcome is
            satisfactory. Project sustainability is rated as likely
            because the improvements in the business environment were
            important and largely irreversible. World Bank performance
            overall was satisfactory. Borrower performance overall was
            unsatisfactory. The folowing lessons are derived from the
            design and the implementation of the project: The
            implementation arrangements shoudl ensure that there is an
            entity formally responsible for project technical
            cordination and monitoring that would be positioned to solve
            problems in a timely manner. An integrated manual of
            procedures for procurement and financial management helps a
            project succeed. Procurement supervision should be carried
            out by qualified staff or a procurement specialist who is
            formally a part of the World Bank team. The executing
            unit's capacity in areas such as procurement, financial
            management, and disbursement, is critical to project
            performance. Sustained commitment, flexibility, and
            expeditious decisionmaking on the part of the government are
            also critical for good project performance. Most
            accomplishments under this project would not have been
            achieved without the commitment of the Senegalese
            authorities to improving the business environment. The
            project's failures reflect government inaction in
            certain areas. An output-based financing mechanism could be
            effective in committing institutions to drive for results
            and achieve their assigned performance.
